meanings.definition: The act of making something immobile or unable to move.
meanings.sent1: After the immobilization of the car, it could not be driven.
meanings.sent2: The doctor recommended immobilization of the injured leg to aid in healing.
meanings.sent3: The immobilization of the runaway shopping cart was quite a sight.
meanings.sent4: Her fear of spiders led to a complete immobilization whenever she saw one.
meanings.sent5: The immobilization of the gears caused the machine to stop working.

meanings.definition: The state of being unable to move or act.
meanings.sent1: The immobilization of the patient's arm was necessary after the surgery.
meanings.sent2: The cat's sudden immobilization in front of the mouse was comical.
meanings.sent3: The immobilization of the sleepy cat on the warm blanket was adorable.
meanings.sent4: The immobilization of time in that moment made it feel eternal.
meanings.sent5: The immobilization of the traffic due to the accident caused delays for hours.
